fields.description:
https://fabric.io/sourcetree/mac/apps/com.torusknot.sourcetreenotmas/issues/5731c6caffcdc042509d74c6

There's no bounds checking for the log view content when validating UI.
fields.summary: Fabric Crash Report #46 - log view validation

fields.description:
https://fabric.io/sourcetree/mac/apps/com.torusknot.sourcetreenotmas/issues/573285a8ffcdc04250a4f576

Keystroke handling in log view controller isn't doing any bounds checking.
fields.summary: Fabric Crash Report #52 - keystroke handling in log view

fields.description:
https://fabric.io/sourcetree/mac/apps/com.torusknot.sourcetreenotmas/issues/5732fdf4ffcdc04250a9094f

Repo Browser's -keyDown is blindly accessing characters without bounds check.
fields.summary: Fabric Crash Report #62 - keystroke handling in repo browser

fields.description:
I've got added today to another team's repo with write permissions but the repo doesn't show up in remote projects in SourceTree.
My personal projects and the ones I have in a team that I created are shown as expected.
fields.summary: project from another team doesn't show up in remote

fields.description:
I am using SourceTree for 2 years with submodules functionality.
Recently things have changed and I cannot stage a module new modification. The message I get is the following:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree rm -q -f – ../../../Quantisweb/mathopti
fatal: ../../../Quantisweb/mathopti: '../../../Quantisweb/mathopti' is outside repository
Completed with errors, see above

On the picture, in the unstated files section, the multi level of .. was not there before.
fields.summary: Submodules do not work anymore

fields.description:
I am new to SourceTree, it crashes when I do a "Publish to Remote"

I have attached a dump from my Mac

(from: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-4573)

from reply to switching from system/embedded git:

"Hi,

I tried this and I still get the same error. As a separate note (not sure if this is relevant), but when I go to upload the git option is greyed out - see attachment. Because of this I also tried making the changes you recommended to the Mercurial setting.

Thanks,

Craig"
fields.summary: Source Tree keeps crashing when I try and push

fields.description:
Every time I start SourceTree - I get a prompt to enter the password for my work account in Bitbucket cloud. I don't uncheck the option "Save password in keychain", and yet no record in Keychain is created.

Some details that may be connected: I have 3 accounts for Bitbucket: 
# Personal account in BB Cloud, the password is stored in keychain 
# Work account in BB Server, the password is stored in keychain
# Work account in BB Cloud, password is not stored and the prompt is up every time I run the app
fields.summary: Doesn't save a password to Keychain on Mac

fields.description:
For example, like diff-highlight does: https://github.com/git/git/tree/master/contrib/diff-highlight

This is something I find really useful and I'd love to have it on SourceTree. Currently, when I want/need to use this (several times during an ordinary work day) I switch to GitHub Desktop (see attached image).

Thanks!
fields.summary: Highlight the changed portions of a line in diff view

fields.description:
It seems like selecting a commit initiates diff calls for all of that commit's changed files which can take a lot of time with some commits and/or repo's.

I would like to see these diff tasks performed in the background and cancellable so that you can quickly switch to a specific changed file within that commit or another commit altogether.

Alternatively I would like to simply have the option to disable this initial viewing of all of the changes in all of the committed files. I generally prefer to just see the changes in a single file at a time anyhow.

PS: For me personally this is a showstopper performance issue. I've started experimenting with MacHg and just using the command line for now. In general, me and most of my colleagues are also dissatisfied with the performance of SourceTree and BitBucket. Speed is of the utmost importance for developer tools!
fields.summary: Do not show spinning beach ball after selecting a commit in Log View

fields.description:
In the newer versions of SourceTree the toolbar doesn't have the "Checkout" option anymore.
There is also no possibility to customize the toolbar by adding it back.
fields.summary: Add the Checkout button to the toolbar

Wait for git lock file to disappear when sourcetree initiated git add and trying to add another file so error message of "index.lock fatal: Unable to create '/path/to/.git/index.lock': File exists.' does not happen.

fields.description:
STR:

1. Open a repository, and view it in full screen (ctrl-cmd-F).
2. Choose “Open Repository Browser” (cmd-0).

Expected: browser window opens atop current window in a regular window format.

Actual: browser window opens atop current window in a regular window format, then spontaneously transforms into a full-screen window in a new space.

The current behaviour is irritating and a waste of time.

Note that by hitting escape (and restoring the window to regular format) will cure this problem from recurring for the rest of the session (until SourceTree is quit).
fields.summary: Bookmarks (repositories) window opens unexpectedly in full-screen mode

fields.description: "Copy Branch Name to Clipboard" was recently added to the right-click context menu. It was placed at the top above the Checkout, Merge, Rebase options. "Copy Branch Name to Clipboard", although useful, is not as important in the list to obstruct the old flow of the context menu.
fields.summary: Move "Copy Branch Name to Clipboard" to bottom of right-click context menu

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Applying a patch in Mode 'Modify working copy files' is using the Unix *patch* command:  !Screen Shot 2016-06-10 at 13.07.04.png|thumbnail! 
Applying a patch in Mode 'Import as full commit' is using the *hg import* command:  !Screen Shot 2016-06-10 at 13.07.26.png|thumbnail! 

When a customer tries to apply a patch with CRLF line endings to a file with LF line endings, in case #2 above applying the patch will succeed, but in case #1 applying the patch will fail.

h3. Suggested Solution
Either use the *hg import* command for both cases, or allow the user to specify which command to use for applying patches in SourceTree Preferences.
fields.summary: Allow the user to select if they want to apply patches with 'hg import' or 'patch' command

fields.description:
Please give a check box to user when compose "custom action", so a "Refresh" can be automatically performed after the custom action. 

Currently, after the custom action is performed (e.g. cherry-pick no commit), the Tree-graph UI is not refreshed and the some time cause confusion if the action is actually performed.
fields.summary: Option to do a UI "Refresh" after custom action

fields.description:
STR:
# Create a new mercurial repository
# Go to Repository->Git Flow/Hg Flow->Initialize Repository
# Enter non-default values for branch names in dialog. Hit OK.
# See first attached screenshot. The default branch will get a .hgflow file in it with the default branch names, not the names you entered
# See second attached screenshot. An uncommitted .flow file with the correct branch names will be in your working directory, waiting to be committed to the default branch.
# Deleting the uncommitted .flow file will confuse SourceTree into thinking that your repo hasn't been initialized.

Note that I don't have any other hg flow extension installed/enabled in my hgrc, just the stock one that ships with SourceTree.
fields.summary: Error initializing repository with built in hg flow

fields.description:
press "alt (option) + ` (backtick)" on any window (except text inputs)... and sourctree dies instantly.

for example, in history view, in the browser... I couldn't replicate the bug on an older mac version
fields.summary: alt+backtick crashes instantly

fields.description: When opening a stash with a large amount of files I should be able to view changes one file at a time. Otherwise it's just a whole lot of scrolling.
fields.summary: Stash view collapse files by default

fields.description:
See attached screenshots.
It seems SourceTree does not handle modifier key properly.
fields.summary: Adding shortcut key "Command + Option + R" to custom action is rejected by "it's used already by the menu item "Reset...""

fields.description: When attempting to "remove" a series of files by using the "Remove" command associated with a folder of files, ST will crash.  I was attempting to do this with unstaged files (although the screenshot shows staged files).
fields.summary: Using the "Remove" command on a source folder causes crash

fields.description:
Hi

One of the common missing features with git GUIs is something akin to Perforce's time-lapse-view:

[https://www.perforce.com/video-tutorials/using-time-lapse-view] (updated link 2018/03/02)

It would be awesome if Atlassian could add a few controls at the top of sourcetree's blame Window/frame that would allow the user to see the blame/diff of the file similar to Perforce's capability.

Regarding agile development processes, even by first just adding a single slider so to be able to slide the reference point (the SHA / time of interest) back and forward in time would be a start. That by itself could be a deliverable story.

Then with follow on sprints, consider the ability to split the slider (again similar to perforce) so to view a greater diff window. Viewing the diff might require more refactoring - TBD.

Etc etc.

Thanks for considering. I would be very willing to help with the UX and any paper prototyping that the team may want (have spent a career in this space and still going).
fields.summary: Add time-lapse-view controls to the blame window

fields.description:
During the resolution of a merge conflict of a single file, using _Resolve conflicts using mine_, checks out _my_ version, discarding any other change (even unconflicted) .

*Reproduction:*
* Sample repository: https://bitbucket.org/volivav/mergebug
* From the branch master, select 'theirbranch' to merge
* A merge conflict appears
* Select the conflicted file, right click on him
* And select _Resolve conflicts... Resolve using mine_

Notes: The sample repository contains two branches with a file, edited so there will be a merge conflict when merging them. The branch `theirbranch` modified the line to trigger a merge conflict and added two lines, which shouldn't be conflicted.

*Expected behaviour:*
The conflicts are resolved by using our version: The conflicted line won't suffer any change from the point of view of the master branch (because _our version_ was marked as right), and the other unconflicted lines from _their_ branch will be added to the merge commit.

*Actual behaviour:*
All the changes made by `theirbranch` are discarded, thus leaving the merge commit empty (i.e., also discarding the added lines from _their_ branch, that had no conflicts)
fields.summary: Resolve conflicts using mine checks out 'my' version

fields.description:
-Since 2.3.1, it is no more possible to paste text into the commit field.-
-It worked fine in 2.3.0-

Seems like something was broken in OSX, partially happened for other apps, a restart fixed the problem.
fields.summary: Regression: Paste Broken in 2.3.1

fields.description:
PLEASE MOVE TO THE MAC PROJECT (I was not able to create a ticket for the mac project).

SourceTree For Mac : Version 2.2.3 (56)

Error on opening a branch-based worktree (git worktree add command) :
{{git status' failed with code 128:'fatal: Not a git repository}}
fields.summary: Error on opening a branch-based worktree

fields.description:
I'm a newbie using SourceTree and github....
I had just brought a second existing local project under git and wanted to create a new remote in github. I had previously succeeded in doing this with my first project.

So in ST I added the bookmark for the local project, selected it, and then pressed +New Repository. I then selected Create Remote Repository from the drop down menu.
An Alert popped up telling me No Accounts Registered etc....
Pressing the OK key to dismiss the Alert cause the crash.
This is completely reproducible. The crash log is attached.

I then selected the Remote button to add my github credentials to ST but must have made a typo. Because I got the Login failed with bad credentials Alert.

I have tried to correct my ST github credentials or find a way to re-enter them. So far with no luck.
fields.summary: Crash - report attached

fields.description: When I use the "Show Repository Browser" shortcut (CMD + O), the "Open..." is performing.
fields.summary: "Open..." and "Show Repository Browser" are using the same shortcut (CMD + O)
Rebease on a commit in the main view does not bring up the rebase dialog on occassion

fields.description: When I select an existing commit, selecting sort by file status is ignored.
fields.summary: Can not sort commit file changes by status

fields.description:
When renaming a branch, the dialog presented is so small that is difficult to change the name. And there is no possibility to change the size of that dialog.
See attached pictures.
A larger dialog (or resizable) would improve the UI.
fields.summary: Renaming text field is too small

fields.description:
With 2.3.1, a new "Copy Branch Name to Clipboard" was added at the top of the context menu which right-clicking on a branch. This is very annoying since previously the first option was "Checkout" followed by "Merge" and "Rebase" – things one does with a branch all the time.
Why was it felt that the "Copy" was such an important feature to add that it had to be put at the top? Is it really likely that a user is going to want to copy the branch name more often than actually working with the branch – such as doing a "Checkout", etc.?
fields.summary: Bring back previous branch context menu behavior.

fields.description: Maybe it could be a nice idea to also see on which branch you are when you want to push a new local repository to a origin because otherwise you have to search on where your branch is before you can push it.
fields.summary: Push repository screen

fields.description:
In the repository browser (under Mac OS X), the path of the bookmarks are absolute paths,  with the format 

/Users/<username1>/...

 In my case, my username <username1>  has been migrated to <username2>, thus in the repository browsers, for all my local repositories I have the message "Repository moved or deleted". Then  when I click it gives me the opportunity to change the folder.  Given that I have a large number of local repositories it would be very time consuming to manually change all of them. I wonder if there way to change all of them in a simple and not time consuming way.  I  have seen that there is "browser.plist" file in ~/Library/Application Support/SourceTree with the path for the repositories. I have tried to change it changing the string for the old username to  the string for  then new username (home folder). But when I restart SourceTree I get an empty Repository Browser.
fields.summary: Changed path of bookmarks

fields.description: When I click "External Diff", FileMerge pops up as expected. When I close FileMerge, SourceTree does not react any longer. I have to force it to quit and restart it.
fields.summary: External Diff (with FileMerge) lets SourceTree crash

fields.description: After making a change to my local repo via command line (pulling, switching branches etc), the SourceTree UI fails to update. I've found that doing a non-destructive action like fetching can force the UI update, but this is very cumbersome. On OS X I believe it's possible to watch the file system for changes, meaning it should be possible to detect these git changes immediately.
fields.summary: UI fails to update when git state is changed by another app

fields.description:
See video here:

https://cloudup.com/coypGBhLGR0
fields.summary: Source tree hangs (spinning beach ball) when performing action on multiple files.

fields.description:
Menu Bar Icons are anaemic in comparison to v1.8.1

It would be great if they could have more weight / more color. The current UI gives the appearance of a washed out web-view with icons that are too small the weight of the content. 

See screenshots.
fields.summary: Menu Bar Icons are anaemic in comparison to v1.8.1

fields.description:
I really like the modal commit sheet, as it preserves the underlying branch context etc. Currently in 2.3.1 clicking commit switches you to the working copy view, with the inline commit section, causing the history and context for the branch that you are currently on to be hidden. 

I would like to see the commit sheet come back, even as an option, as this would allow for the preservation of context while committing.
fields.summary: Bring back the commit sheet.

fields.description:
Previously, the number of lines both added and removed was shown for each hunk in the diff viewer. This is no longer the case. I would like to see this return to SourceTree.

See screenshots.
fields.summary: Number of changed lines for each hunk no longer shown in diffs.

fields.description:
Commit options now appear to be hidden in a drop down menu in 2.3.1. This means that their current state is hidden while writing your commit messages etc. 

Previously, the list of options was always visible, as they were individual check boxes. 

I'd like to see a return to check boxes that are always visible, or at a minimum some additional UI indicator outside of the drop down menu for enabled options. 

e.g. a string around the commit options like "amend, pull request" etc.
fields.summary: Commit options in a drop-down hide them from view, even when selected.

fields.description:
I'm trying to switch over from 1.8.1 that i've been using forever and i'm struggling with a few issues that i feel are regressions from the previous UI. 

Currently the number of files that fit into an area is much less than it was previously, so those with large numbers of files in their commits end up suffering.

See attached screenshots for comparison. 

I'd like to see this tightened up to match v1.8.1 sizing.
fields.summary: Compress the row height in file table views

fields.description:
When using iTerm2 v3.0.0 or higher, clicking the "Terminal" button to open a Git repository crashes SourceTree. The terminal button works normally with regular iTerm and Terminal (Mac native).

SourceTree opens iTerm2 successfully, but seems to crash when changing to the project directory.

iTerm2's AppleScript syntax changed with v3.0.0 (technically 2.9.20140903), which may be the cause of the issue.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when using "Open in terminal..." button with iTerm2 v3.0.0+

fields.description:
SourceTree becomes sluggish after running for about an hour or so. If not restarted manually, it often crashes after running for a bit longer than this.

Issue occurs when using external Git version 2.8.3.
fields.summary: Memory Leak since 2.3.0

fields.description:
After working for a certain amount of time, I get the following messages (see attachment) that keep popping up until I close sourcetree in activity monitor.
My Chrome seems to be crashing as well, so I figure this is a OS X related issue?
fields.summary: Run out of file descriptors

fields.description: Is very annoying that first option is copy branch name, I'm used to checkout using context menu better than double click.
fields.summary: Context Menu first option should be checkout not copy name

fields.description: Please turn off the "Push Changes immediately" checkbox if there are new commits on the remote branch.  I can't pull those until I commit my local changes, and if they are pushed right away the push will fail. The flow would work better if that flag could be just a bit smarter.  After all SourceTree knows there are new commits as it numbers them in the pull icon.
fields.summary: Make "Push Changes immediately" a bit smarter

fields.description:
The function "Copy path to clipboard" works for files but not for folders.
See attached screenshot
fields.summary: Copy path to clipboard does not work for folders

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you check out a remote branch as a new local branch, the dropdown filter of branches does not automatically refresh with the new local branch.

h3. Environment
SourceTree for Mac

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a git repository that is already linked to a remote repo
# Featch all branches from the remote repo
# Checkout a remote branch as a new local branch, e.g. develop here:  !Screen Shot 2016-06-01 at 19.26.12.png|thumbnail! 
# Once it is created, click the dropdown filter of branches, you will see that develop is missing:  !Screen Shot 2016-06-01 at 19.27.46.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Results
The newly created local branch shows in the list

h3. Actual Results
The newly created local branch does not show in that list

h3.Workaround
If you close and re-open the repo window and then re-open it, the local branch name will show up in the dropdown
fields.summary: Checking out a remote branch as a new local branch does not update the dropdown filter of branches

fields.description:
Recent versions of SourceTree have changed the keyboard shortcut for Window->"Show Repository Browser" from "⌘B" to "⌘O". This conflicts with, and is overridden by File->Open having the same shortcut. 

Please change it back or find an alternate shortcut :)
fields.summary: Show Repository Browser duplicate keyboard shortcut

fields.description:
Bitbucket recently introduced app passwords, making 2FA usable. Unfortunately Sourcetree doesn't seem to support it. I get the following error even with an app password that has full permissions:

Login failed for your Bitbucket account.

The remote service said: 'Login error'

Is there any way for me to get access to a log in order to provide additional info?
fields.summary: Support Application Passwords in Bitbucket

fields.description: Please add a toolbar icon for the git-lfs feature similarly to how GitFlow works.

fields.description:
Hi,
I'm using SourceTree version 2.2(46) in my mac (OS X El Capitan 10.11.5).
It gets stuck after merge every single time. 
After merge, I have to use the "Force quit" to close the SourceTree app and re run it in order to continue the merge.
It's not related to conflicts- it gets stuck whether I have some merge conflicts or not.
Let me know if you need more details.
fields.summary: Tool gets stuck after merge

fields.description:
When I add 2 files with special characters in the file name to the Git staging area, it cannot be removed by SourceTree. See the attached screenshot. 

This is the output from *git status*


{code:bash}
$ git status
On branch split-commit
Changes to be committed:
  (use "git reset HEAD <file>..." to unstage)

	new file:   "vms/checkin/%89PNG\r\n\032\n"
	new file:   "vms/checkout/%89PNG\r\n\032\n"
{code}
fields.summary: Cannot remote file with special characters from git staging area

fields.description:
Since enabling (or shortly after?) GIT large file support on my repository, now SourceTree runs extremely slow when staging files.  If I click the checkbox next to a file, it'll take maybe 15 seconds to stage a file.  Doesn't matter if I check one file or all... takes about the same time.  Unstaging files does not have this problem.  Also I can stage/unstage individual hunks and it is fast.

If I look at the Activity Monitor while this is happening, it shows git-lfs process running.

Also, if I stage the file from the git command line then it happens immediately.
fields.summary: Extremely slow to stage files - 'git-lfs' process running in activity monitor

fields.description:
- start off with client not aware that there's an update to pull on remote
I know there is one, because someone in my team just pushed an update
- I click the pull button anyway
- what seems to happen in the background is that ST is refreshing remote status
- (x) the pull fails because of a lock problem (probably created by the refresh)
- I have to 'ack' the error, and then pull again - which works now that there's no refresh happening.

I would prefer that:
a. either the pull would wait in the refresh to finish
b. OR it would just retry / override the problem and pull

Thanks
Dan
fields.summary: pull fails while update remote repo status

fields.description:
-> Create a new Xcode project and check the option to create a local Git repository.
-> Add some code, make some commits
-> Drag the folder on ST so it gets added as a bookmark
-> Right-click the "Remotes" section header and choose "New Remote"
-> Create a new remote on Github, call it "origin"
-> Select that remote.
-> OK the commit msg template chooser that's still open.

Result:
Remotes section is still empty ("Show" button not visible, nor can I choose "origin" when pushing).

Expected:
The new remote should be there, and I should be able to add it.

Note:
The Github repository was successfully created, no error alerts were shown by ST.

Only ST-related log message I found:
28/05/16 14:46:03,340 SourceTree[29871]: Could not connect action, target class STRepoSettingsSheetController does not respond to -gpgHelpClick:
fields.summary: Can't add remotes anymore

fields.description: In prior versions of ST, the toolbar offered buttons for creating and applying patch files. These appear to have disappeared, and cannot be re-added via the “Customize Toolbar…” sheet either.
fields.summary: “Create/appy patch” toolbar buttons have vanished; restore them

fields.description:
In "uncommitted changes" view, you can see the modified file list.
But when I click logs, the file list disappeared.
fields.summary: In log view, there is no modified files list.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Assume you have a repo which has a folder e.g. folderA in its working directory.
You open the repo in SourceTree and go to {{File Status}}, select {{All Files}} from the dropdown.
You then right-click folderA >> {{Log Selected...}} and it shows all commits of files in that folder.

However, this includes only commits of existing files in folderA.
If I used to have e.g. myfile.txt in that folder, and later on deleted it... then the commits that added and deleted the file don't show in the {{Log Selected...}} for that folder.

Additionally, commits with files that were renamed in that folder don't show in the {{Log Selected}} of the folder.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option to show the log of deleted & renamed files in folders as well.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see commits of deleted & renamed files in Log Selected option of a folder in SourceTree

fields.description:
Reproducing step.
1. Select "New Remote..." in context menu of "WORKSPACE" in Sidebar, but it does not add remote by clicking OK button
2. Enter new remote information to Remote Panel, click OK
3. Click OK on Settings Panel without switching "Remotes" tab

If switched "Remotes" tab before step 3, adding new remote successes.
fields.summary: Can't add remote by "New Remote..." in context menu of "WORKSPACE" in Sidebar

fields.description:
Sometimes crashes after clicking on Push button.
Crash log attached.
fields.summary: Crash on pushing commits

fields.description:
+STR+
# Create new branch "branch_a"
# Go to "History" view
# Filter history to only show "branch_a"
# Go to "File status" view
# Rename "branch_a" to "branch_b" (or delete branch)

+EXP+
* No error
* "History" view should show renamed branch or All Branches

+ACT+
* Error Encountered: "'git log' failed with code 128:'fatal: bad revision 'branch_a'"
* "History" view is empty with "branch_a" filter still applied

+Notes+
There error will continue to show intermitently until I go back to History view and remove the filter.
fields.summary: Error notice after branch is gone

fields.description: Simple feature request - it would be nice to have an icon next to local branches which are tracked. I work in an environment that some of my branches are local only and some are tracked against remote. I don't know which ones I've pushed unless I click through to different menus.
fields.summary: Icon for tracked branches

fields.description:
(⌘O) shortcut is used both for "Open..." and "Show Repository Browser" when ⌘O is pressed the "Open ..." dialogue is opened...

"Show Repository Browser" used to be ⌘B ...
fields.summary: (⌘O) shortcut is used both for "Open..." and "Show Repository Browser"

fields.description: Since Hg-attic was removed in the last update, these were moved to a Hg-attic shelve. You can then create a new shelf with the exact same name, with no error. However, when you do this the old one will be moved to the standard shelf and if you then delete one of them, the other is also delete.
fields.summary: Naming and deleting a shelf with same name as an old hg-attic shelve will move and delete hg-attic shelve

fields.description: open in Terminal only move the focus to the Terminal not open a terminal window and cd path to the file
fields.summary: issue on open in Terminal

fields.description:
Previous versions of SourceTree for Mac used to have *Window --> Show Repository Browser* mapped to Command+H. In at least 2.3 (and maybe previous some previous releases), it was swapped to Command+O, which is already mapped to *File --> Open File...*.

h4. Expected Result

Each of the two commands should have its own unique key mapping.

h4. Actual Result

Each of the two commands have the same key mapping.
fields.summary: Command+O Mapped to Multiple Commands

fields.description:
Right click | add remote 

Fill in, click ok -> it unexpectedly presents the `commit template` dialog, and doesn't add the remote.
fields.summary: Can no longer add remote

fields.description: In "commit template" tab controls are messed up. Other tabs are ok. MacOSX 10.10.5.
fields.summary: Controls overlay in repository settings

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The repository has lots of branches and SourceTree displaying the similar colors for some of the branches.
Hence, it's hard to follow the graph line of a selected branch.
Example:
 !GraphLine.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
When a branch is selected, the graph line of the branch will be highlighted and easy to be view.
eg. When Branch A is selected, the line of the Branch A in the graph will be highlighted.
fields.summary: Highlight the graph line of the selected branch

fields.description: The commit template settings screen has layout issues.
fields.summary: Commit template settings screen has layout issues

fields.description:
When I select some lines in the "uncommitted changes" view, and then click "Discard lines", Sourcetree sometimes crashes.

Looks like you're trying to create a dictionary from a nil object:

fields.summary: crash when discarding selected lines

fields.description: Attached screen shot displays date formatted in Japanese while selected Language is "English(U.S.)" and  System Language is "Japanese".
fields.summary: Relative date in commit history is formatted in System language instead of selected Language in Preferences.

fields.description:
Hi!

When I look through diffs in source tree to find old code that is needed again, or move a change to a different file, I copy the text directly from the diff view.  Unfortunately, it also copies the + and  - characters (depending on what lines were added/removed).  When copying large chunks of code you have to go through and individually remove the incorrect (+) and (-) characters.

A find replace all isn't a good solution to this problem because the - and + characters are used commonly in most languages.
fields.summary: When copying code from the diff view, addition (+) and delete (-) characters are also pasted.

fields.description:
{{Window->Show Repository Browser}}  and  {{File->Open}} now both share the same {{cmd+O}} shortcut key. This makes it impossible to access repository browser using keyboard shortcut.
It used to be {{cmd+B}} for repository browser.
fields.summary: conflicting shortcut keys

fields.description:
Look at the first screenshot. I scrolled down in the history area to find an old commit. I scrolled down in the sidebar to find an old tag. I cannot see what branch I'm on. I cannot see if I have uncommitted changes.

Now look at the screenshot of the old version. Look at the bottom of the window. No matter where you scroll in the main part of the window you can always, at a glance, see exactly which branch you're currently on and whether or not your working folder is √ Clean.
fields.summary: Bring back the status bar at the bottom of the window

fields.description:
Just to let you know that the "commit" icon being a ring made me chuckle about daily. Was brilliant, no pun intended.

If you can't bring it back, oh well, that's a pity, but congrats to whomever had the idea anyway ;).
fields.summary: Lost the commitment ring!

fields.description: Previously I could select a commit, and in the bottom view there used to be the description of the commit which I could copy paste. Now there's only diffs of the affected files in the commit.
fields.summary: History view changed. Cannot copy paste description anymore

fields.description: When a tag message is very big, the tag details window height is bigger than the screen height and the OK button is hidden.
fields.summary: Can't close tag details window if message is too big for screen height

fields.description:
It is reproducible every time for me. I've attached the crash log, I think it is an easy fix.
Steps to reproduce:
1) Checkout any branch, commit something with any commit message.
2) Checkout another branch
3) Click on the commit message text field so it becomes the first responder
4) Press CMD Z
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when user presses CMD+Z on empty commit message field

fields.description:
The Git Flow actions do not have an option to sign off commits and tags. Unlike a commit or tag created manually, there is no *Sign tag* option. 

See attachment for reference to Add Tag feature that has the *Sign tag* option.
fields.summary: Cannot sign commits and tags for Git Flow

fields.description: Clicking the words "remote account" crashes Sourcetree every time.
fields.summary: Consistent crash when clicking link in "clone a repository" panel of remote repository browser.

fields.description:
The "Log Selected" context menu of a file in a commit only shows the history of that file up to that commit. To see a full log up to the present I have to find a later commit that includes that same file or go to the command line.

It would be nice if there was a "Log Current Version" to complement "Log Selected Version" similar to how there are both "Open Current Version" and "Open Selected Version".

Would also be nice to have an "Open Both Current and Selected Versions" command.

See also https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-2863
fields.summary: Log Selected + Log Current Version

fields.description:
SourceTree 2.3 seems to consistently crash with the following steps:
# Pull from another branch with "Rebase instead of Merge" selected
# Force push the branch to remote
If you reopen SourceTree after the crash and force push again, it completes successfully, so it probably has something to do with doing the two steps together
fields.summary: Crash after Pull/Rebase, Force Push

fields.description: The preview of the git flow is not visible. See attachment.
fields.summary: Gitflow preview not visible

fields.description:
In older versions, the merge dialog had a checkbox for Create a new commit even if fast-forward is possible.
Now I have to go to the preferences menu each time I want to change it.
My workflow sometimes requires merging with fast-forward, and sometimes without, and the checkbox was very useful/
fields.summary: Please bring back "Create a new commit even if fast-forward is possible"

fields.description:
When opening the settings sheet for a given repository, the Commit Template screen layout is broken. No interaction is possible with the text area that is visible.

!sourcetree-template-bug.png!
fields.summary: Repository settings sheet displays a broken Commit Template UI
"Remove file" crashes in Tree View

fields.description:
h3. Reproduction steps
# Create a local branch and create changes
# Commit changes, but don't push
# Right-click branch > Create Pull Request...

h3. Expected Results
SourceTree should perform similar actions as the Repository > Create Pull Request.. menu option and push the changes or prompt you to push the changes.

h3. Actual Results
SourceTree does nothing and does not indicate what the problem is to the user.
fields.summary: Create Pull Request... context menu does nothing if you have not pushed the branch to remote

fields.description:
It would be very handy in the commit templates if I could add a variable that contained the branch name.

That would allow you to automatically include it during commit, for every feature branch using git-flow, that used the associated ticket as the feature branch name.

This might also be handy in Custom Actions.
fields.summary: Add branch name variable for commit templates

fields.description: Screenshot explains it best. The menu options for Commit Template are unreachable by mouse
fields.summary: Commit template menu unusable

fields.description:
As already stated here https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/38744736/how-to-change-auto-push-to-use-tracked-branch-instead-of-origin I see the following problem:

I use a repository with two origins and multiple branches like this:

{noformat}
origins:
master: github
local: bitbucket server

branches (+tracking):
master - origin / master
local  - local / master
{noformat}

When I commit my changes I get the option to automatically push my changes.
The push target however is always using the origin remote, not the one that is tracked.

I don't see a setting to change this and this behavior leads to false commits if you forget to uncheck that box. As of this I assume this is a  bug.
fields.summary: Auto push using origin instead of tracked branch

fields.description:
I'm often need to move manually set tags.
Usual workflow is:
* delete tag locally and remotely;
* set same named tag locally and push it to origin remote.
I've tried to use Advanced ability of "Tag Window" - "Move tag", but it moves only local tags.
Is it possible to move a remote tag as same as a local one?

Regards,
Anton.
fields.summary: Move remote tag error

fields.description:
My SourceTree app for Mac is up-to-date(2.3(65))
When I press the display-off shortcut(control + shift + eject), the SourceTree app is crashed.
The shourtcut doesn't mean sleep mode, just display off.
However, it works fine in my iMac environment.

iMac env.
iMac 5k Late 2014
Memory : 24GB
Mac OS X El Capitan 10.11.4

Both use Korean language.

Thank you.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when press display off shortcut

fields.description:
The show repository browser has the default keybinding of command + o, which happens to be the same keybinding as open. Hitting command + o brings up the open file dialogue as Im assuming as open appears first in the menus and takes precedence. The original keybinding to show the repository browser was command + b.

I believe this is affected by the bold keybinding that was brought in with the commit message formating of this version.

Maybe command + shift + b would be a good replacement keybinding
fields.summary: Show repository browser has same keybinding as open

fields.description: When you click on Commit button on top toolbar, the sidebar menu does not highlight file status.  Instead, it stays highlighted on the last selected option.  See screenshot.
fields.summary: Sidebar menu not highlighting proper option when clicking on Commit button

fields.description: ST was left unattended for 30 minutes, and abort dialog was present on the screen after returning.
fields.summary: Idle crash report

fields.description: Using SourceTree Mac standalone. OS X 10.10.5. The new upgrade no longer seems to present me with a Preview of what's going to happen when I use HgFlow for Finish Feature.
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.3 HgFlow not showing Preview for Finish Feature

fields.description:
Currently, if I e.g. turn off the WiFi on my MacBook and then try to push, the error message I get is:


{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v --tags origin refs/heads/master:refs/heads/master 
Pushing to git@github.com:uliwitness/Forge.git
ssh: Could not resolve hostname github.com: nodename nor servname provided, or not known
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
Completed with errors, see above
{noformat}

Not very self-explanatory what is wrong. Would be nice if SourceTree noticed when the network is down and showed a more specific error message.
fields.summary: Need better error messages when network is down
